message.content:
cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.PF

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on the placement and routing of virtual network functions (VNFs) in order to optimize power consumption and meet delay and capacity requirements. This falls under the domain of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes an Integer Linear Programming (ILP) formulation and heuristics to solve the VNF placement and routing problem. This involves designing a system to optimize power consumption and meet performance requirements, which falls under the domain of systems and control. 
3. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper deals with the placement and routing of VNFs in a network, which involves distributed computing and resource allocation. 
4. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with optimizing the placement and routing of VNFs to meet capacity requirements, which involves information theory concepts such as channel capacity and data rates. 
5. cs.PF (Performance) - The paper aims to optimize the performance of the network by minimizing power consumption and meeting performance requirements, which falls under the domain of performance evaluation and optimization.
